name: plguffer
desc: is touch-starved, but always hurts those he gets close to

name: anchovy
desc: gets jealous of sardine's popularity over anchovies as a food item, but doesn't realize how much it sucks to get eaten.

name: tuna
desc:
marches tuna beat of its drum.
also has an irrational fear of cats

name: sardine
desc: is claustraphobic

name: bream
desc: is very immersed in its hobbies, and tends to bream with joy when asked about them

name: largemouth bass
desc: a bassist based in basston, MA. bass't you don't basster him if you know what's bass't for ya

name: smallmouth bass
desc: a smalltown bassball player from bassechussetts who has bass'ted its peers and fishes to surbass the greats

name: rainbow trout
desc: is in the closet about its sexuality, however all of the other fish already know it's queer

name: salmon
desc: despite always being overshadowed by its red cousin, this salmon plans to make itself KNOWN

name: walleye
desc: is a fan of sci-fi movies, its favorite being one about a little trash robot and survey robot who fall in love

name: perch
desc: is fully aware that it is a freshwater fish in the ocean. it, like the other freshwater fish, has learned to "just get over the salinity"

name: carp
desc: would probably be a fantastic carpenter, but unfortunately fish don't have access to a reliable source of wood.

name: catfish
desc: is the kind to lie about its appearance on dating apps

name: pike
desc: once scaled an entire mountain in colorado; the mountain gets its name from this legendary fish

name: 'lil sunfish
desc: typically overshadowed by its much bigger sibling, this fish is often subject to comparison. "why do you keep on bringing up my brother? you should care about me as a person! my size doesn't matter!" it says, crying

name: red mullet
desc: is completely stuck in the 80's. it tries to be modern by dying itself red, but to no avail
shinyDesc: is completely stuck in the 80's. it tries to be modern by dying itself blue, but to no avail

name: herring
desc: says it has crucial evidence on a murder case. despite initial skepticism, detectives determined that this isn't a red herring.
shinyDesc: says it has crucial evidence on a murder case. however, detectives determined that this IS a red herring.

name: octopiss
desc: is a big introvert, and tries its best to blend in with the crowd

name: red snapper
desc: literally red with anger, it will snap at anyone who is even the slightest annoyacne
shinyDesc: remarkably, this snapper is not red with anger. its calm demeanor reveals it's true colors.

name: eel
desc: yes, i'm being for eel with you

name: sea cucumber
desc: not a substitute for actual cucumbers

name: ghostfish
desc: a rare, sightless fish native to caves. this one blindly found its way to these waters... somehow

name: stonefish
desc: stonefish don't get their name due to their stone-like appearance! it actually comes from their diet of rocks and other stone-like material. this one appears to have swallowed an entire cinderblock whole

name: crimsonfish
desc: lives deep in the ocean, but comes to the surface to work on its tan

name: angler
desc:
how many angler fish does it take to change a light bulb?
zero. they are dumb fish who only focus on eating dumber fish

name: ice pip
desc: melts relatively quickly, so never handle them for too long!

name: lava eel
desc: is on vacation in these serene waters. it says its hometown is in an active volcano, and i honestly can't tell if it's bluffing or not...

name: plantfish
desc: a fish that somehow has the ability to photosynthesize. they were considered to be the solution to world hunger due to their great nutritional value and hypothesized easy mass production. unfortunately, they explode on death. because of course they do

name: grugfish
desc: despite their large head size, their brains remain completely useless. it's a miracle that they even exist to this day. they are sought out by collectors due to their rarity

name: mutacarp
desc: a species that was bioengineered in an unethical lab. this fish was intended on being a weapon, but just ended up ugly. these were released into the wild and ended up becoming an invasive species.

name: sandfish
desc: used to be found in deserts such as the sahara desert. however, due to global warming, they were forced to move to beaches, then the ocean

name: scorpion carp
desc: the media says that it is just a carp with a sharp stinger. however, conspiracists argue that scorpion carps are actually scorpions in mech suits

name: flounder
desc: got caught eating a yet another quarter-flounder. what a flatass

name: midnight carp
desc: sibling of the common carp, this fish has a preference of staying up and playing video games instead of actually sleeping

name: lobter
desc: typically red-dy to start a new day with a bang! You will rarely find one of these creatures blue
shinyDesc: this one is quite blue, and could use some cheering up...

name: shrimp
desc: it's as shrimple as that

name: crayfish
desc: say your crayers

name: sturgeon
desc: I AM A STURGEON! I. AM. A. STURGEON!!! I AM- I AM A STURGEON!!!! I AM A STURGEON, DR. HAN! I AM A STURGEON!

desc:
"Rrrawwrrrr!! Rrawrrr! Rawwrrrr!!! mprrrr. rawr rar? prrrr :3 rawr rawer rarrr!! :333 mprwwww,,, rawr rar rar? roar rawarr!!! purrr,,, rrrrrrrrr. nyaur! ^w^"

name: Lingcod
desc: The lingcod or ling cod, also known as the buffalo cod or cultus cod, is a fish of the greenling family Hexagrammidae. It is the only extant member of the genus Ophiodon. It has been observed up to a size of 152 centimetres and a weight of 59 kilograms. It is spotted in various shades of gray.
